law.catch_line: There is a Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board....

text.section: There is a Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board.

section.section: The board consists of seven members.
Each member of the board shall be a resident of the county.
The board shall select a chairperson from among its members, to serve the term that the board sets.
The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the board on October 1, 2002.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section:
The board may recommend to the county commissioners:
the types of gaming devices that may be operated in the county;
approval or denial of a gaming permit; and
modifications of the county gaming regulations and procedures.
As the county commissioners consider appropriate, the county commissioners shall provide for the board a clerk, legal counsel, supplies, and funding.
The county commissioners may pay salaries to the members of the board.
